page.title: 07Farming-Laughton Area, 3
page.content: Most of the farmers in our area grow arable crops. The main crops are wheat, potatoes, rape and barley. Hardly any farmers these days have dairy cattle. Before the 2nd World War, all the farmers around here kept milking cows. Lots of farmers though keep beef cattle. Usually they buy young cattle in February. They keep these animals in sheds until about April, when the weather gets better and the grass starts to grow. The cattle stay in the fields until October. By this time there is not much grass and the weather is starting to get cold, so they are brought back into sheds and fed on silage, which is hay that the farmer has cut in the summer and which is now beginning to rot. By next May the cattle have grown to about 10cwt., which is just about right to be made into meat.
